summary: This bill, the Venezuelan Adjustment Act, authorizes the Secretary of Homeland Security to adjust the status of certain Venezuelan nationals in the U.S. to lawful permanent residents. Eligibility criteria include entering the U.S. before or on December 31, 2021, and continuous physical presence for a year. The bill outlines exceptions based on criminal history, covers stay of removal, work authorization, and administrative/judicial review. It also specifies that adjustment of status under this act does not offset the number of immigrant visas available.
